title: EM induction - how to induce emf in loop

content.question: A rectangular loop of wire lies in the <math alttext="x y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-plane in a region with a uniform magnetic field <math alttext="vector B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mover><mi>B</mi><mo>â†’</mo></mover></math> directed in the <math alttext="negative z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mi>z</mi></mpadded></math>-direction, as shown. In which of the following cases will an <math alttext="e m f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>emf</mi></math> be induced in the loop?

choices.label: When the loop is moving without rotating in the <math alttext="positive y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mi>y</mi></mpadded></math>-direction
When the loop is moving without rotating in the <math alttext="positive z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mi>z</mi></mpadded></math>-direction
When the loop is rotating about an axis along the <math alttext="z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>z</mi></math>-axis
When the loop is rotating about an axis along the <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>y</mi></math>-axis

content.answer: When the loop is rotating about an axis along the <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>y</mi></math>-axis
